did.abstract: This collection contains a small amount of materials documenting the day-to-day activities of ARISE (A Regional Initiative Supporting Empowerment).
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: ARISE (A Regional Initiative Supporting Empowerment) was a regional organization that sought to unite and revitalize faith and community groups by having them shape public policies; serve as a coalition for social, political, and economic change; and revive New York's Capital District communities. ARISE was established in 1997 as a coalition of Schenectady County churches and community organizations. The following year, the organization expanded to Albany, Rensselaer, and Saratoga Counties thanks to grants from the Catholic Campaign for Human Development and Urban Ministries of the Presbyterian Church (USA). ARISE was open to all faith-based congregations, community groups, neighborhood associations, and membership organizations. It remained active through the 2010s.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The collection includes event materials, correspondence, and newspaper clippings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lynne Jackson donated all materials in this collection to the M.E. Grenandner Department of Special Collections and Archives in April 2021.
